image_analysis.description: Return a brief summary of what you can see on the image, listing all formatting elements and visible text. Identify the position of page number(s) and footnote(s) on the image precisely.

transcription.description:
- Task: Return a **markdown-converted, verbatim transcription** of the provided image.
- Scope — include everything: Transcribe **all** visible text and structural elements: headers; footers; page numbers; tables; etc. unless exceptions are given in the system instructions or additional context. 
- Markdown formatting: Use markdown formatting for transcribing text, e.g., `*italic*` or `**bold**`; `# Heading 1`, `## Heading 2`, etc.
- Equations: Convert any equations to **LaTeX** and enclose them in `$$ … $$`.
- Page numbers — exact format: Write page numbers appearing on headers and footers (not in the main text or tables) like this example: `<page_number>9</page_number>`.
- Footnotes: Format footnotes (in the main text and in footers) like in this example: `[^1]: My reference`.
- Images or diagrams: Indicate their presence with a detailed description in square brackets, e.g., `![Image: diagram of a cell]`.
- Layout preservation: **Preserve all line breaks** exactly as in the image.
- Multi-column text: Transcribe column by column (finish column 1 before column 2, etc.), keep line breaks within columns intact.
- Cross-page continuity: This is likely one page of a multi-page document. **Preserve any sentences that continue from the previous or to the next page exactly as shown.**
- Output format: Provide **only** the transcription. If **no transcribable text** is found, output `null`.
- No fabrication: **Do not hallucinate.** Keep spelling, punctuation, and wording **verbatim**.

no_transcribable_text.description: True if the image contains no transcribable text; otherwise, false.

transcription_not_possible.description: True *if and only if* transcription is entirely impossible; otherwise, false.
